byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

abstract: Silent on German White Book statements
snippet: WASHINGTON, April 1--An investigation by the House of Repre  sentatives of the German White Book to determine its authenticity with particular reference to the statements in it attributed to William C. Bullitt, United States Ambassador to France, ...

headline.main: FISH ASKS INQUIRY ON NAZI WHITE BOOK; Introduces House Resolution to Determine Authenticity of German Documents DOUBTS THEIR FABRICATION Reynolds in Senate Suggests Bullitt Appear to Explain Remarks Laid to Him Thorough Inquiry Urged Nazis Challenge Bullitt Archives Held Transferred Soviet Prints Reports

lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, April 1--An investigation by the House of Repre sentatives of the German White Book to determine its authenticity with particular reference to the statements in it attributed to William C. Bullitt, United States Ambassador to France, and Joseph P. Kennedy, Ambassador to Great Britain...
